# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in C#

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is the sounding of the individual notes of a chord in succession rather than all together. In this case, the arpeggio we are looking at is the Minor 7th chord in the key of C#.

## Notes and Intervals
The C# Minor 7th arpeggio consists of the following notes:
- C# (Root)
- E (Minor 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- B (Minor 7th)

The intervals between the notes are as follows:
- Root to Minor 3rd: 3 half steps
- Minor 3rd to Perfect 5th: 4 half steps
- Perfect 5th to Minor 7th: 3 half steps

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 7th arpeggio in C# is often used in jazz, R&B, funk, and soul music. It adds a soulful and jazzy flavor to the music, creating a sense of depth and emotion in the melodies and harmonies.

## Songs
Here are three songs that prominently feature the C# Minor 7th arpeggio:
1. "All Blues" by Miles Davis
2. "Use Me" by Bill Withers
3. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder

Now that you have learned about the Minor 7th arpeggio in C#, you can explore its use in various genres and songs to further enhance your understanding of music theory and performance.
